snippet: The restored London town house of Khadambi Asalache, the Kenyan poet and artist, is opening for some tour groups.
abstract: Eve M Kahn Antiques column; National Trust is finishing a two-year restoration of Kenyan poet Khadambi Asalache's London house and will allow trial tour groups in July; plans to open house, which was transformed into a work of art by Asalache, to the public by appointment in Spring 2013; exhibit Posters of Paris: Toulouse-Lautrec and His Contemporaries, showcasing French advertising posters from the 1880s, opens at the Milwaukee Art Museum.
lead_paragraph: The restored London town house of Khadambi Asalache, the Kenyan poet and artist, is opening for some tour groups.

headline.seo: Antiques - Khadambi Asalache’s London House Restored
headline.main: Curlicues and Cleopatra in Kenyan Poet’s House
headline.print_headline: Curlicues and Cleopatra in Kenyan Poet’s House
